newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL tin ends up 11 cents, tracks London's rebound.
newsitem.headline: KL tin ends up 11 cents, tracks London's rebound.

text.p: Malaysia's tin price closed up 11 cents at 14.80 ringgit ($5.86) a kg, moving in tandem with the London Metal Exchange (LME) where tin prices rebounded $55 on Tuesday, traders said.
"The local market was basically moving in line with LME. There's no other leads at the moment," said one trader.
Turnover was 159 tonnes, up from 79 on Tuesday, and buyers were from Europe, Japan and Malaysia, traders said.
The local price premium over the LME narrowed to $45 a tonne against $65 on Tuesday, the traders said.
